cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 365 mi SE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest, expected to turn northwest and approach the middle Texas coast, then stall inland over south-central Texas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast between Port O'Connor and Corpus Christi, TX

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch south of Port Mansfield TX to the Mouth of the Rio Grande and north of San Luis Pass to High Island TX; Hurricane Watch south of Port Mansfield TX to the Mouth of the Rio Grande
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning Port Mansfield to San Luis Pass TX; Hurricane Warning Port Mansfield to Matagorda TX; Tropical Storm Warning north of Matagorda to High Island TX and south of Port Mansfield TX to the Mouth of the Rio Grande
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impacts focused along the Texas coast from Port Mansfield northward to High Island with secondary impacts possible into southwestern Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Outer-band breezes could bring sustained winds 20–30 mph with higher gusts to coastal Mississippi late this weekend.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft above normal tides possible along the Mississippi coast, but significant inundation (>3 ft) is not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of intermittent heavy rain bands possible Sunday–Monday, with localized ponding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along Gulf beaches.
